definition: alongside
the termination of a pregnancy after, accompanied by, resulting in, or closely followed by the death of the embryo or fetus: such as
relating to or involving general ideas or qualities rather than an actual object, person, etc.
a school usually above the elementary level; especially : a private high school
an effort in speech to stress one syllable over adjacent syllables; also : the stress thus given a syllable
capable or worthy of being accepted
the quality or state of being accepted or acceptable
occurring unexpectedly or by chance
something supplied for convenience or to satisfy a need: such as
agreement, conformity
in accordance : correspondingly
one that gives an account or is accountable
the system of recording and summarizing business and financial transactions and analyzing, verifying, and reporting the results; also : the principles and procedures of this system
something that has accumulated or has been accumulated
freedom from mistake or error : correctness
a charge of wrongdoing
to make familiar with something through use or experience
to suffer a usually dull persistent pain

a sour substance; specifically : any of various typically water-soluble and sour compounds that in solution are capable of reacting with a base to form a salt, redden litmus, and have a pH less than 7, that are hydrogen-containing molecules or ions able to give up a proton to a base, or that are substances able to accept an unshared pair of electrons from a base

a disorder of the skin that is marked by blemishes (such as whiteheads, blackheads, or pustules) especially on the face, chest, and shoulders and is caused by inflammation of sebaceous glands and hair follicles; especially : a form found chiefly in adolescents
to cause to know personally
the state of being acquainted
a field especially of arable land or pastureland
one who advocates or practices activism : a person who uses or supports strong actions (such as public protests) in support of or opposition to one side of a controversial issue
characterized by sharpness or severity of sudden onset
one exhibiting a compulsive, chronic, physiological or psychological need for a habit-forming substance, behavior, or activity

a compulsive, chronic, physiological or psychological need for a habit-forming substance, behavior, or activity having harmful physical, psychological, or social effects and typically causing well-defined symptoms (such as anxiety, irritability, tremors, or nausea) upon withdrawal or abstinence : the state of being addicted
of or relating to administration or an administration : relating to the management of a company, school, or other organization
a person legally vested with the right of administration of an estate
deserving the highest esteem : excellent
the commander in chief of a navy
a feeling of respect and approval
the period of life when a child develops into an adult : the period from puberty to maturity terminating legally at the age of majority
to worship or honor as a deity or as divine
acting against or in a contrary direction : hostile
someone who gives advice
having or exercising power to advise
a feeling of liking and caring for someone or something : tender attachment : fondness
feeling or showing affection or warm regard : loving
to bring or receive into close connection as a member or branch
validate, confirm
a forceful action or procedure (such as an unprovoked attack) especially when intended to dominate or master
intense pain of mind or body : anguish, torture
pleasing to the mind or senses especially as according well with one's tastes or needs
the science, art, or practice of cultivating the soil, producing crops, and raising livestock and in varying degrees the preparation and marketing of the resulting products
impermeable to air or nearly so
a passage for a current of air (as in a mine or to the lungs)
a passage (as in a theater or railroad passenger car) separating sections of seats
of, relating to, or caused by alcohol
watchful and prompt to meet danger or emergency
a generalization of arithmetic in which letters representing numbers are combined according to the rules of arithmetic
to cause to be estranged : to make unfriendly, hostile, or indifferent especially where attachment formerly existed
to bring into line or alignment
to assert without proof or before proving
of, relating to, affected with, or caused by allergy
altered bodily reactivity (such as hypersensitivity) to an antigen in response to a first exposure
a garden or park walk bordered by trees or bushes

either of two large carnivorous, thick-skinned, long-bodied, aquatic, crocodilian reptiles (Alligator mississippiensis of the southeastern U.S. and A. sinensis of China) that have a broad head with a slightly tapered, long, rounded, U-shaped snout and a special pocket in the upper jaw for reception of the enlarged lower fourth tooth; broadly : crocodilian
a sum granted as a reimbursement or bounty or for expenses; especially : a sum regularly provided for personal or household expenses
to unite or form a connection or relation between : associate —usually used with with or to

the drupaceous fruit of a small tree (Prunus dulcis synonym P. amygdalus) of the rose family with flowers and young fruit resembling those of the peach; especially : its ellipsoidal edible kernel used as a nut
along the side : in parallel position
a set of letters or other characters with which one or more languages are written especially if arranged in a customary order
occurring or succeeding by turns
the vertical elevation of an object above a surface (such as sea level or land) of a planet or natural satellite
a silver-white metallic chemical element with atomic number 13 that has good electrical and thermal conductivity, high reflectivity, and resistance to oxidation —often used before another noun
to fill with wonder : astound
having or controlled by ambition : having a desire to be successful, powerful, or famous
a vehicle equipped for transporting the injured or sick
to put right; especially : to make emendations in (something, such as a text)
in or into the middle of : surrounded by : among
in or into the middle of : surrounded by : among
generous or more than adequate in size, scope, or capacity
to expand (something, such as a statement) by the use of detail or illustration or by closer analysis
to entertain or occupy in a light, playful, or pleasant manner
a comparison of two otherwise unlike things based on resemblance of a particular aspect; also : one of the two things being compared
a person who analyzes or who is skilled in analysis
of or relating to analysis or analytics; especially : separating something into component parts or constituent elements
a device usually of metal attached to a ship or boat by a cable and cast overboard to hold it in a particular place by means of a fluke that digs into the bottom
a spiritual being serving as a divine messenger and intermediary and often as a special protector of an individual or nation; especially : one in the lowest rank in the celestial hierarchy
possessing or characterized by life : alive
to disturb or irritate especially by repeated acts
the act of annoying someone or of being annoyed
a song or hymn of praise or gladness

a substance able to inhibit or kill microorganisms; specifically : an antibacterial substance (such as penicillin, cephalosporin, and ciprofloxacin) that is used to treat or prevent infections by killing or inhibiting the growth of bacteria in or on the body, that is administered orally, topically, or by injection, and that is isolated from cultures of certain microorganisms (such as fungi) or is of semi-synthetic or synthetic origin
existing since or belonging to earlier times : ancient
a word of opposite meaning
apprehensive uneasiness or nervousness usually over an impending or anticipated misfortune : a state of being anxious
in any manner whatever
an admission of error or discourtesy accompanied by an expression of regret
to express approval especially by clapping the hands
marked commendation : acclaim
an act of applying
one who applies
a garment usually of cloth, plastic, or leather usually tied around the waist and used to protect clothing or adorn a costume
unusually fitted or qualified : ready
a container (such as a glass tank) or an artificial pond in which living aquatic animals or plants are kept
a typically curved structural member spanning an opening and serving as a support (as for the wall or other weight above the opening)
the scientific study of material remains (such as tools, pottery, jewelry, stone walls, and monuments) of past human life and activities
